public class Server
extends Thread
A very basic MUD (Multi User Dungeon) server, designed to be accessed by clients using the "telnet" protocol.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Tristan Greaves

fail 
 public static void fail(Exception e,
                         String text)
Exits Minimud when another part of the program throws a particularly nasty exception. The exception along with a textual explanation is sent to the screen.

Parameters:
e - Exception
text - Description of failure
log 
 public static void log(String text)
Logs MiniMUD activity (time/date stamped). At the moment, we only output to System.out (instead of a file).

Parameters:
text - Text to log
run 
 public void run()
Sits waiting for client connections. When a client connects, a new "Connection" thread is spawned for each one.

Overrides:
run in class Thread
main 
 public static void main(String args[])
Handles any command line arguments. The user can pass the port they want to use via the command line if they desire. If everything is okay a new Minimud is created.

Parameters:
args - Command line arguments
